results.title: Do I need planning permission? - Wakefield Council
results.snippet: Permitted development rights allow private households to make minor alterations and extensions. This can be done without formal planning permission.

results.title: Building regulations - Wakefield Council
results.snippet: Building regulations are separate from planning permission. The regulations apply to most building work, with a few exemptions.

results.title: Renewable energy at home - Wakefield Council
results.snippet: Solar electricity panels, or solar photovoltaics (PV), capture sunlight, converting it into usable electricity for your home. This provides renewable energy, ...

results.title: Protected trees - Wakefield Council
results.snippet: If a tree has a TPO or is in a Conservation Area, you need prior consent from the Council to fell or prune it. To work on a protected tree (TPO and Conservation ...

results.title: Help with home energy improvements - Wakefield Council
results.snippet: If you're a tenant, you will need to speak to your landlord before you apply because you'll need their permission before any insulation can be installed. It is ...

context.need: I'd like to install solar panels on my house and want to know if I need permission to have someone undertake this work.

recommendation.reason: Link appears suitable for user needs
next_steps: Follow the link to access the content

Reason.need: I'd like to install solar panels on my house and want to know if I need permission to have someone undertake this work.
Reason.reasoning: The content provides information about making a planning application, but it doesn't explicitly state whether solar panel installation requires planning permission or not. However, based on common sense and the context of installing something external on a property, it's reasonable to assume that some form of planning permission might be required. Since no specific information is available, the content could benefit from a clear statement about solar panel installations.
Reason.next_actions: I would contact the local council's planning department for confirmation regarding solar panel installation and any associated permissions.

analysis.overall_assessment: While the information provided is generally helpful, it falls short in addressing specific questions that a council resident might have, such as whether they need permission for installing solar panels. The council's website could benefit from more comprehensive and targeted content to better serve residents' needs.
